content: Derrida’s debt to other readings (of Nietzsche) should be presupposed in its totality
linkedContent: Derrida’s debt to other readings (of Nietzsche) should be presupposed in its totality

content: “question of style” always concerned w/ weight (le pesant) of pointy object (stiletto, stylus, rapier, quill), which attacks matter/matrix, leaving a mark
linkedContent: “question of style” always concerned w/ weight (le pesant) of pointy object (stiletto, stylus, rapier, quill), which attacks matter/matrix, leaving a mark

content: question of style, des voiles, laissons l’élytre flotter entre masculin et féminin > our tongue [the French one] assures la jouissance [re: double gender of des voiles]
linkedContent: question of style, des voiles, laissons l’élytre flotter entre masculin et féminin > our tongue [the French one] assures la jouissance [re: double gender of des voiles]

content: also the protection against this threat, se pliant alors ou repliant, en fuite, derrière des voiles
linkedContent: also the protection against this threat, se pliant alors ou repliant, en fuite, derrière des voiles

content: déjà, nom de ce qui s’efface ou d’avance se soustrait, laissant néanmoins une marque, une signature soustraite dans cela même don il se retire > style uses spur to protect against this subtraction
linkedContent: déjà, nom de ce qui s’efface ou d’avance se soustrait, laissant néanmoins une marque, une signature soustraite dans cela même don il se retire > style uses spur to protect against this subtraction

content: spur, sporo, spor, to spurn [in Mallarmé], word, trace, wake, indication, mark
linkedContent: spur, sporo, spor, to spurn [in Mallarmé], word, trace, wake, indication, mark

content: [it is impossible, and the English translation, I believe, fails to convey this, to tell whether the spur protects against presence or the threat to presence]

content: protects against what stubbornly (avec entêtement) se donne à voir [thrusts itself into view]

content: fine point (of spur) cannot be honed (effiler) in single stroke (coup)
linkedContent: fine point (of spur) cannot be honed (effiler) in single stroke (coup)

content: style advances as spur: 1) prow of sailing vessel, rostrum, cleaving hostile surface of sea 2) rocky point, also éperon, on which waves break at harbor’s entrance
linkedContent: style advances as spur: 1) prow of sailing vessel, rostrum, cleaving hostile surface of sea 2) rocky point, also éperon, on which waves break at harbor’s entrance

content: the sharp point, the prow of the boat, can protect (against that which always thrusts into view)
linkedContent: the sharp point, the prow of the boat, can protect (against that which always thrusts into view)

linkedContent: style-spur (le style éperonnant) as oblong object w/ its tissues, webs, sails, veils, thus its apotropaic power > also an umbrella

content: all Nietzsche’s investigations, especially those of woman > coiled in labyrinth of ear
linkedContent: all Nietzsche’s investigations, especially those of woman > coiled in labyrinth of ear

linkedContent: Derrida reads éperons, the cliffs (feet), in Nietzsche’s “here I stand in the midst des Brandes der Brandung (of the surging of the breakers)”

linkedContent: [re: Nietzsche’s “—Distanz!”] hyphen & exclamation mark invite us, by way of pirouette & play of silhouette, to keep distance from veils [woman] that make us dream of death

content: Nietzsche: we wanderers see our heights as places of safety
linkedContent: Nietzsche: we wanderers see our heights as places of safety

content: not only keep your distance from woman, game of seduction, but woman as non-figure, non-identity, distance’s very chasm, interval’s cadence, distance itself [which can’t be said]
linkedContent: not only keep your distance from woman, game of seduction, but woman as non-figure, non-identity, distance’s very chasm, interval’s cadence, distance itself [which can’t be said]

linkedContent: Heidegger’s Entfernung, de-ferment, distantiation of distance, veiled enigma of proximation, distance itself constituted by destruction (Ent-)

content: Nietzsche: modesty of life, veils: “Yes, life is a woman!” [see p. 59 truth becomes profound by disguising of pudendum, by modest veil that falls over it]
linkedContent: Nietzsche: modesty of life, veils: “Yes, life is a woman!” [see p. 59 truth becomes profound by disguising of pudendum, by modest veil that falls over it]

content: if woman is truth, she knows there is none, that no one has a place for truth
linkedContent: if woman is truth, she knows there is none, that no one has a place for truth

content: woman but one name for untruth of truth, depthless depths that distorts identity, essence, property, brings philosophy to ruin
linkedContent: woman but one name for untruth of truth, depthless depths that distorts identity, essence, property, brings philosophy to ruin

content: “the exchange of stylistic blows (coup) or the thrust (coup) of a dagger confuses sexual identity”
linkedContent: “the exchange of stylistic blows (coup) or the thrust (coup) of a dagger confuses sexual identity”

content: the feminine, that which cannot be pinned down by truth > this should not be mistaken for woman’s femininity, female sexuality, nor an essentializing fetish [for those inexperienced brobags (philosophers, artists) who believe they can capture]
linkedContent: the feminine, that which cannot be pinned down by truth > this should not be mistaken for woman’s femininity, female sexuality, nor an essentializing fetish [for those inexperienced brobags (philosophers, artists) who believe they can capture]

content: via Nietzsche, woman believes in superficiality of existence, disguising pudendum, nothing more than affair of modesty, decency > “truth” nothing but a surface, becomes desirable by way of veil; suspend the veil, or let it fall differently, no longer truth, only “truth”
linkedContent: via Nietzsche, woman believes in superficiality of existence, disguising pudendum, nothing more than affair of modesty, decency > “truth” nothing but a surface, becomes desirable by way of veil; suspend the veil, or let it fall differently, no longer truth, only “truth”

content: skepsis of truth as old as woman herself > skepticism, veiling dissimulation
linkedContent: skepsis of truth as old as woman herself > skepticism, veiling dissimulation

content: Nietzsche’s writing as inscription of truth, elevated (se lève) in quotation marks (machination, cri, vol et pinces d’une grue), cet écart de la vérité qui s’enlève d’elle-même > the feminine “operation”
linkedContent: Nietzsche’s writing as inscription of truth, elevated (se lève) in quotation marks (machination, cri, vol et pinces d’une grue), cet écart de la vérité qui s’enlève d’elle-même > the feminine “operation”

content: mustn’t we reconcile Nietzsche’s apparently feminist propositions w/ his overwhelming corpus of “venomous (acharné) anti-feminism” > question still remains: de ce que je fais ici en ce moment
linkedContent: mustn’t we reconcile Nietzsche’s apparently feminist propositions w/ his overwhelming corpus of “venomous (acharné) anti-feminism” > question still remains: de ce que je fais ici en ce moment

content: if style were a man (like Freud says penis is prototype of fetishes), writing would be a woman
linkedContent: if style were a man (like Freud says penis is prototype of fetishes), writing would be a woman

content: [re: truth-castration as man’s affair, and woman’s suspension of it] [English translation seems horrible] Derrida is asking that we take off the head (décapitonner) of Lacan’s discourse, w/ its truth speaking, castration & phallocentrism > by deploying metaphorics of veil

content: if truth is only on the surface, why the fear, la pudeur? woman as suspension of truth & castration > truth-castration as l’affaire de l’homme, his credulity, man is never sufficiently old (assez vieux), dissimulating, or skeptical

content: castration describes a margin whose consequences are incalculable
linkedContent: castration describes a margin whose consequences are incalculable

content: were woman to believe in anti-castration, she would return plus sûrement to the same old machine, phallogocentrism’s attendant, disciple discipliné du maître > “we?” should learn from her
linkedContent: were woman to believe in anti-castration, she would return plus sûrement to the same old machine, phallogocentrism’s attendant, disciple discipliné du maître > “we?” should learn from her

content: woman plays w/ castration, does not believe in it, nor its opposite (much too clever for that),  but she can’t seduce w/out it, needs castration’s effects, but as she plays w/ it, she anticipates her laughter (at man)
linkedContent: woman plays w/ castration, does not believe in it, nor its opposite (much too clever for that), but she can’t seduce w/out it, needs castration’s effects, but as she plays w/ it, she anticipates her laughter (at man)

content: because of castration’s undecidable contours, its topographical problems, and because only man decides his discourse on her/truth concerns her > la femme slips away (s’esquivait)
linkedContent: because of castration’s undecidable contours, its topographical problems, and because only man decides his discourse on her/truth concerns her > la femme slips away (s’esquivait)

content: for Nietzsche, since man alone believes in woman-truth, women feminists are men too, lay claim to truth > perd le style (gone the style)
linkedContent: for Nietzsche, since man alone believes in woman-truth, women feminists are men too, lay claim to truth > perd le style (gone the style)

content: does Nietzsche refer to Jew because of the way circumcision marks simulation & castration?
linkedContent: does Nietzsche refer to Jew because of the way circumcision marks simulation & castration?

content: the double role of woman as truth’s recession, and as the nonbeliever in truth, she is like the Jew in her “delight in dissimulation,” affirmative power
linkedContent: the double role of woman as truth’s recession, and as the nonbeliever in truth, she is like the Jew in her “delight in dissimulation,” affirmative power

content: Nietzsche: can woman really want enlightenment? is she simply looking for new adornment? nothing has been more alien to woman than truth, her great art is the lie
linkedContent: Nietzsche: can woman really want enlightenment? is she simply looking for new adornment? nothing has been more alien to woman than truth, her great art is the lie

content: “what is woman?” is suspended by fact that it is impossible to dissociate [woman, the question of woman] from problematic of truth, art, style
linkedContent: “what is woman?” is suspended by fact that it is impossible to dissociate [woman, the question of woman] from problematic of truth, art, style

content: Heidegger’s 3 warnings on reading Nietzsche: 1.	simply aestheticizing his work as philosopher-artist would corroborate current order of philosophy 2.	do not confuse “heroic-boastful” style (pseudo-transgressive exuberance) for “grand style” 3.	must read Nietzsche as unremitting interrogation of Western civilization
linkedContent: Heidegger’s 3 warnings on reading Nietzsche: 1. simply aestheticizing his work as philosopher-artist would corroborate current order of philosophy 2. do not confuse “heroic-boastful” style (pseudo-transgressive exuberance) for “grand style” 3. must read Nietzsche as unremitting interrogation of Western civilization

content: Heidegger’s 3 propositions related to these warnings: 1. there’s only been a philosopher before art, a gossiping woman, a sterile woman (not a männliche Mutter); acc. Nietzsche, the old aesthetic nothing but that of passive, receptive consumers 2. Nietzsche’s art would be “metaphysical in its most intimate intention” 3. Nietzsche deals (most frequently) w/ Plato by simple inversion (Umdrehung), standing Platonic propositions on their head
linkedContent: Heidegger’s 3 propositions related to these warnings: 1. there’s only been a philosopher before art, a gossiping woman, a sterile woman (not a männliche Mutter); acc. content: Hegel on passivity of clittoral pleasure (de la jouissance clitoridienne)
linkedContent: Hegel on passivity of clittoral pleasure (de la jouissance clitoridienne)

content: Heidegger oscillates btwn reading in Nietzsche a simple Umdrehung (inversion) of Plato or something other > neither a direct flipping, nor an an-archical erasure of hierarchy (which consolidates established order), but “a transformation of hierarchical structure itself”
linkedContent: Heidegger oscillates btwn reading in Nietzsche a simple Umdrehung (inversion) of Plato or something other > neither a direct flipping, nor an an-archical erasure of hierarchy (which consolidates established order), but “a transformation of hierarchical structure itself”

linkedContent: pratique stylet, pratique stylée, de quel genre? can’t be written w/out conjoined fabulation of woman/truth, entre la femme, in spite of the profundity that is modesty

content: the becoming-woman (becoming Christian) of the idea, the veiling of truth, is the beginning of history, the idea s’éloigne, devient transcendante, inaccessible, séduisante, the dream of death begins (Heidegger avoids this becoming-woman in his own analysis of History of an Error)
linkedContent: the becoming-woman (becoming Christian) of the idea, the veiling of truth, is the beginning of history, the idea s’éloigne, devient transcendante, inaccessible, séduisante, the dream of death begins (Heidegger avoids this becoming-woman in his own analysis of History of an Error)

content: Nietzsche: “women are considered profound, why? because one never fathoms their depths, women aren’t even shallow”
linkedContent: Nietzsche: “women are considered profound, why? because one never fathoms their depths, women aren’t even shallow”

content: the becoming-female, Christian, an epoch in parenthesis, a woman castrates and plays at her castration, feigns castration (at once suffered & inflicted) [see HYMEN]
linkedContent: the becoming-female, Christian, an epoch in parenthesis, a woman castrates and plays at her castration, feigns castration (at once suffered & inflicted) [see HYMEN]

content: Nietzsche: in Sermon on the Mount, things not looked at from a height
linkedContent: Nietzsche: in Sermon on the Mount, things not looked at from a height

content: castratism of the Church, excision (Ausschneidung), hostile to life (lebensfeindlich): so, if woman is life (femina vita), Christianity hostile to woman > la castration est une opération de la femme contre la femme, non moins que de chaque sexe contre soi et contre l’autre ——Nietzsche: “the spiritualization of sensuality is called love: it represents a great triumph over Christianity [?]”
linkedContent: castratism of the Church, excision (Ausschneidung), hostile to life (lebensfeindlich): so, if woman is life (femina vita), Christianity hostile to woman > la castration est une opération de la femme contre la femme, non moins que de chaque sexe contre soi et contre l’autre ——Nietzsche: “the spiritualization of sensuality is called love: it represents a great triumph over Christianity [?]”

content: Nietzsche’s 3 “positions” on woman: 1. woman is figure of falsehood, man as phallus is truth ; man fears castrated woman 2. woman is the figure of truth, plays w/ truth as a fetish ; man fears castrating woman 3. woman as artist, Dionysiac, dissimulatrice, castration doesn’t take place; love affirming woman
linkedContent: Nietzsche’s 3 “positions” on woman: 1. woman is figure of falsehood, man as phallus is truth ; man fears castrated woman 2. woman is the figure of truth, plays w/ truth as a fetish ; man fears castrating woman 3. woman as artist, Dionysiac, dissimulatrice, castration doesn’t take place; love affirming woman

content: Nietzsche’s style not an impregnable, infinite mastery, doesn't impeccably manipulate the snare (piège), doesn’t calculate the undecidable like Leibniz’ God (a falling back into the trap), nor does he use parody/simulacrum as a weapon, which would lead to a Nietzsche cult (interprêtrise of parody) > rhythmic blindness of hymen/margin “inscribes castration’s effect w/in itself” > dans le toile du texte, Nietzsche is lost, a spider, or spiders, unequal to the web spun
linkedContent: Nietzsche’s style not an impregnable, infinite mastery, doesn't impeccably manipulate the snare (piège), doesn’t calculate the undecidable like Leibniz’ God (a falling back into the trap), nor does he use parody/simulacrum as a weapon, which would lead to a Nietzsche cult (interprêtrise of parody) > rhythmic blindness of hymen/margin “inscribes castration’s effect w/in itself” > dans le toile du texte, Nietzsche is lost, a spider, or spiders, unequal to the web spun

content: hymen’s graphic, that of the pharmakon, inscribes castration’s effects w/in itself, w/out being reduced to it
linkedContent: hymen’s graphic, that of the pharmakon, inscribes castration’s effects w/in itself, w/out being reduced to it

content: regular, rhythmic blindness takes place in Nietzsche’s text, he’s lost there too > il y a de la perte, dès qu’il y a hymen
linkedContent: regular, rhythmic blindness takes place in Nietzsche’s text, he’s lost there too > il y a de la perte, dès qu’il y a hymen

content: no such thing as woman, as truth in itself of woman in itself
linkedContent: no such thing as woman, as truth in itself of woman in itself

content: no truth in itself of sexual difference in itself, homme/femme en soi > but, ontology w/ its verification of identity, w/ its arraisonnement, shelters (recèle) undecidability of sexual difference
linkedContent: no truth in itself of sexual difference in itself, homme/femme en soi > but, ontology w/ its verification of identity, w/ its arraisonnement, shelters (recèle) undecidability of sexual difference

content: re: veil, to delimit, undo, come undone, would this not return again to unveiling? the destruction of the fetish? as much as it is a question, this question is interminable
linkedContent: re: veil, to delimit, undo, come undone, would this not return again to unveiling? the destruction of the fetish? as much as it is a question, this question is interminable

content: question of style, spurring-operation, more powerful than thesis, meaning: stylate spur rips through veil, to show the veil, to undo opposition veil/unveiled (sailed/unsailed) [voilé/dévoilé]
linkedContent: question of style, spurring-operation, more powerful than thesis, meaning: stylate spur rips through veil, to show the veil, to undo opposition veil/unveiled (sailed/unsailed) [voilé/dévoilé]

content: Nietzsche’s analysis of sexual difference, “eternal war btwn sexes,” based on propriation, where woman takes shape acc. formalized law > woman is woman because she gives herself to a man who takes possession, or la femme en se donnant se donne-pour, simule et s’assure ainsi la mâtrise possessive: if opposition give/take, possess/possessed, is a “transcendental snare” produced by hymen’s graphics, process of propriation would escape dialectics and ontological decidability
linkedContent: Nietzsche’s analysis of sexual difference, “eternal war btwn sexes,” based on propriation, where woman takes shape acc. formalized law > woman is woman because she gives herself to a man who takes possession, or la femme en se donnant se donne-pour, simule et s’assure ainsi la mâtrise possessive: if opposition give/take, possess/possessed, is a “transcendental snare” produced by hymen’s graphics, process of propriation would escape dialectics and ontological decidability

content: can no longer ask “what is property?” > because propriation, a sexual operation, before which we didn’t know sexuality [?], is undecidable, more powerful than ti esti, than veil of truth, meaning of being—it organized all ontological statements > l’histoire (de la) vérité (est) un procès de propriation ——a singular limit, limit of being itself, not derivative of question of being, but also not available to investigation > onto-hermeneutic limitation shows chaque fois que surgit la question du propre in restricted fields (economy, linguistics, rhetoric, psychoanalysis, politics)
linkedContent: can no longer ask “what is property?” > because propriation, a sexual operation, before which we didn’t know sexuality [?], is undecidable, more powerful than ti esti, than veil of truth, meaning of being—it organized all ontological statements > l’histoire (de la) vérité (est) un procès de propriation ——a singular limit, limit of being itself, not derivative of question of being, but also not available to investigation > onto-hermeneutic limitation shows chaque fois que surgit la question du propre in restricted fields (economy, linguistics, rhetoric, psychoanalysis, politics)

content: acc. Heidegger, Nietzsche belongs to metaphysics because his thought aimed to culminate it [Derrida asks whether belonging has one value, and, if so, would it carry belonging beyond itself]
linkedContent: acc. Heidegger, Nietzsche belongs to metaphysics because his thought aimed to culminate it [Derrida asks whether belonging has one value, and, if so, would it carry belonging beyond itself]

content: [re: Heidegger’s reading of Nietzsche, that he still belongs to history of metaphysics] reading opens internal necessity, a certain dehiscence, but no critical/destructive effect: mais elle en transforme la figure et réinscrit à son tour le geste herméneutique [see pp. 81-3, p. 123]
linkedContent: [re: Heidegger’s reading of Nietzsche, that he still belongs to history of metaphysics] reading opens internal necessity, a certain dehiscence, but no critical/destructive effect: mais elle en transforme la figure et réinscrit à son tour le geste herméneutique [see pp. 81-3, p. 123]

content: Heidegger’s abyssal structure of the proper, at once superficial & bottomless (since not fundamental), the proper founders, passes into the other
linkedContent: Heidegger’s abyssal structure of the proper, at once superficial & bottomless (since not fundamental), the proper founders, passes into the other

content: once there’s valuation (valorisation) of the proper, it can never be interrupted, a permanency that is valuation itself > its necessity must be interrogated sans cesse [re: Heidegger]
linkedContent: once there’s valuation (valorisation) of the proper, it can never be interrupted, a permanency that is valuation itself > its necessity must be interrogated sans cesse [re: Heidegger]

content: (das Eigentum des Ab-grundes) the proper-ty of the abyss, the abyss of proper-ty, the reorganization of metaphysics around more powerful question of propriation, question of event (Ereignis) uprooted from ontology, where proper is proper to no one, to nothing: is this what Nietzsche’s woman is, style’s form: the no-where, gift as woman’s essential predicate, appears in undecidable oscillation btwn give/take, se donner/se donner-pour > price/value of pharmakon ——just as there’s no essence of the woman or sexual difference, there’s no essence of es gibt Sein
linkedContent: (das Eigentum des Ab-grundes) the proper-ty of the abyss, the abyss of proper-ty, the reorganization of metaphysics around more powerful question of propriation, question of event (Ereignis) uprooted from ontology, where proper is proper to no one, to nothing: is this what Nietzsche’s woman is, style’s form: the no-where, gift as woman’s essential predicate, appears in undecidable oscillation btwn give/take, se donner/se donner-pour > price/value of pharmakon ——just as there’s no essence of the woman or sexual difference, there’s no essence of es gibt Sein

content: Heidegger’s giving of the gift cannot be thought of in terms of Being (neither subject nor object), not in Being’s horizon, nor truth, nor meaning; no essence of es gibt, no essence of woman or sexual difference > can’t apprehend/oppose to gift of Being a determined gift (whether body, subject, sex—la femme n’aura donc pas été mon sujet)
linkedContent: Heidegger’s giving of the gift cannot be thought of in terms of Being (neither subject nor object), not in Being’s horizon, nor truth, nor meaning; no essence of es gibt, no essence of woman or sexual difference > can’t apprehend/oppose to gift of Being a determined gift (whether body, subject, sex—la femme n’aura donc pas été mon sujet)

content: on following Nietzsche outside speculum, the hermeneutic circle > immeasurable, save for the the steps of a dove (qu’au pas de colombe) [these are the steps of the Übermensch]
linkedContent: on following Nietzsche outside speculum, the hermeneutic circle > immeasurable, save for the the steps of a dove (qu’au pas de colombe) [these are the steps of the Übermensch]

linkedContent: Heidegger warns against transforming Being into species/case of genus proprier, a mere incident in Ereignis > futility of such conceptual reversal btwn species/genus

content: possible forgetting [?] of their code makes all texts open, undecipherable, and structurally posthumous (the author will die w/ the key inside, will forget it even)
linkedContent: possible forgetting [?] of their code makes all texts open, undecipherable, and structurally posthumous (the author will die w/ the key inside, will forget it even)

content: Derrida exposes cryptic structure of writing by “confessing” to it “directly,” re: Nietzsche’s forgetting the umbrella; one could never heed the cryptic warning, what if the “limits of will to mean” are exactly what Nietzsche meant w/ this phrase, an intentional graft

linkedContent: were the key to the secret of a text “btwn me and myself,” I will still die > relation to event of text as structurally posthumous necessity > text remains open, offered, undecipherable

content: for Heidegger, forgetting of a being incommensurable w/ forgetting of Being: [Derrida quotes Heidegger: can’t understand forgetting as a human fact, as omission, Being not umbrella of distracted philosopher, forgetting attacks essence of Being, is the Destiny of the essence of Being]

content: “moment sexual difference is determined as an opposition, the image of each term is inverted into the other” > the 2 X’s à la fois subject/predicate, their copula a mirror: man wants ideal man in woman, woman ideal woman in man > homosexual effacement à l’infini

content: la signature et le texte tombent l’un hors de l’autre, se sécrètent, se séparent, et s’excrètent, se forment de la coupure même qui les décapite, les échafaude en tronc sans tête, dès l’instant de leur itérabilité > expropriative commencement marks everything erected w/ structure of etron [fecal matter]
